markdownRemark.html:
Score: 82.5

ibtimes.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of International Business Times, providing coverage of business, economics, politics, and technology in several markets worldwide.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

IBT Media Inc., a private company headquartered in New York City, owns and operates International Business Times. The company acquired Newsweek magazine in 2014, was rebranded as Newsweek Media Group in 2017, but returned to its original name in September 2018.

In October 2018, IBT Media co-founder Etienne Uzac and former chief executive and publisher Will Anderson were charged by the Manhattan District Attorney with conspiring to defraud lenders. They pled not guilty.

Content

IBTimes provides news coverage and analysis of business, economic, political, and technological issues, producing editions for the U.S., Australia, China, India, Singapore, and the U.K. Typical stories report on topics such as the growth and pitfalls of cryptocurrencies, the latest performance of China’s manufacturing sector, and an examination of gun sales in the U.S.

Stories in the Media & Culture section provide coverage of celebrities and pop-culture figures. Other sections include Opinion, Sports, and Luxury. The site carries stories from wire service Reuters and The Motley Fool, a financial site.

Credibility

IBTimes stories are produced by staff reporters or aggregated from reports in credible news organizations, with attribution. Headlines are straightforward and accurately reflect content. Opinion is distinguishable from news, published in a dedicated section.

IBTimes does not articulate a corrections policy, but corrections are run in the form of a note, in bold italics, at the top of stories.

In 2017, the Drum Online Media Awards in the U.K. named an IBTimes technology reporter as Digital Writer of the Year.

Transparency

IBTimes names its authors but does not provide contact or biographical for them. The site does not provide information about its editors or disclose anything about its ownership and financing.

IBTimes did not respond to NewsGuard’s two emails inquiring about its lack of disclosure of its ownership, site leaders, and content creators.

Advertising is distinguishable from editorial content.

History

IBTimes.com launched in 2006.

Written by:
Evan Haddad

Edited by:
Jim Warren Eric Effron
